You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Colicoid. The Colicoid language uses sounds produced by the antennae and jointed legs of the colicoids, including humming sounds and clicks, which makes it difficult for other species to speak.

Due to your carapace and the shape of your body, you are ill-suited to wearing armor. Your carapace provides ample protection, however; it gives you a base AC of 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You gain no benefit from wearing armor, but if you are using a shield, you can apply the shield's bonus as normal.
Colicoids typically stand 6 to 6 and a half feet tall and generally weigh about 170 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 25 feet.
Your stinger is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d4]] kinetic damage.
Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.
Culisetto reach adulthood at 8 years old, and live to be about 60.
Culisettos' thirst for blood cause them to tend towards the dark side, though there are exceptions.

If you spend at least 1 minute devouring the corpse of a beast or humanoid, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier. Once you've used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.
You have a climbing speed of 25 feet.
Whenever you make a Wisdom (Perception) check related to sight, you are considered to have expertise in the Perception skill.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Culisetto. Culisetto is composed of high pitched whines made from the snout.

If you jump at least 10 feet in a straight line before hitting with a melee weapon attack, you can attempt to trip the target as part of the same attack. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
You have supreme control over your feet and can use them to manipulate objects as well as your hands.
Culisetto stand between 3 and 4 feet tall and weigh about 45 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Small.
Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

When you make a long jump, you can cover a number of feet up to twice your Strength score. When you make a high jump, you can leap a number of feet up into the air equal to 3 + twice your Strength modifier.
If you surprise a creature and hit it with an attack on your first turn in combat, the attack deals an extra [[/r 2d6]] damage to it. You can use this trait only once per combat.

You only need 3 hours of sleep during a long rest to gain its benefits, instead of 6. Additionally, if your long rest would be interrupted, you only need to complete the long rest instead of restarting it to gain its benefits.

Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields or martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.
Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.
Dashade reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Dashade's aggressive yet loyal nature causes them to tend toward lawful dark side, though there are exceptions.
Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d6]] kinetic damage.
Due to their unique physiology, dashade hardiness allows them to overcome use of the Force. You have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws against force powers.
Whenever you make a Dexterity (Stealth) check to avoid detection by electronic sensors and cameras, you are considered to have expertise in the Stealth skill.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Dashadi. Dashadi is characterized by its low pitch and elongated growls.
You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.
Dashade are naturally able to resist radiation. You have resistance to necrotic damage.
Dashade typically stand 5 and a half to 6 and a half feet tall and generally weigh around 200 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.
Defel reach adulthood in their early teens and live less than a century.
Defel tend toward no particular alignment. The best and worst are found among them.
Your claws are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d4]] kinetic damage and have the finesse property.

You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

As a bonus action, you can turn invisible until the start of your next turn or until you attack, make a damage roll, or force someone to make a saving throw. Once you've used this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Defel. Most defel refuse to speak Galactic Basic while on their home planet of Af'El unless they have a specific need for it.
You have proficiency in scavenging kits.
Defel typically stand 4 to 5 feet tall and generally weigh around 100 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Small.
You are proficient in the Stealth skill.
Your base walking speed is 25 feet.
You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.
If you surprise a creature and hit it with an attack on your first turn in combat, the attack deals an extra [[/r 2d6]] damage to it. You can use this trait only once per combat.

Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.
Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.
Diathim reach adulthood in their late teens and live about 100 years.
Diathim are naturally empathetic, causing them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.
You can survive for one day within the vacuum of space.

You can use your psychic aura to influence individuals of both sexes. Whenever you roll a 1 on a Charisma (Persuasion) check, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll. Additionally, once per short or long rest, you can treat a [[/r d20]] roll of 9 or lower on a Charisma check as a 10. This feature has no effect on droids or constructs.
You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. While wearing medium or heavy armor, your flying speed is reduced by half.

Diathim are too weak to pack much of a punch. You have disadvantage on Strength saving throws, and when determining your bonus to attack and damage rolls for weapon attacks using Strength, you cant add more than +3.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and one extra language of your choice.

Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to amplify your radiant aura, causing a searing light to radiate from you. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet, and at the end of each of your turns, you and each creature within 10 feet of you take psychic damage equal to half your level (rounded up). In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra psychic damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a power. The extra psychic damage equals your level.
Diathim typically stand 6 to 9 feet tall and generally weigh about 100 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your creature type is both aberration and humanoid.
Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.
Dowutins are considered a child until around the age of 75 in which they are a full fledged adult. Dowutins can live upwards of 900 years with even more ancient ones exceeding that.
Dowutins are aggressive and brash, causing them to tend toward the dark side, though there are exceptions.
Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d4]] kinetic damage.

You have a thick hide. While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws made to avoid exhaustion due to extreme cold.
You have proficiency in the Survival skill.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that involve hearing or smell.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Dowuta. Dowuta consists of deep, booming vocalizations and is considered difficult for members of other species to emulate.
Your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples.

Dowutins have a unique special characteristic; from birth to death, they never stop growing. Even as an adolescent, dowutins tend to tower over other species, reaching heights over 8 feet and weighing 400 pounds. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Strength score increases by 1.
Draethos reach adulthood around their late teens and live up to 800 years.
Draethos tend toward no particular alignment. The best and worst are found among them.
You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Draethos. Draethos is characterized by its flurry of cacophonous sighs and clicks.
Draethos typically stand between 6 and 7 feet tall and weigh around 190 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You can communicate telepathically with creatures within 30 feet of you. You must share a language with the target in order to communicate in this way.
You have proficiency with light and medium armor as well as vibroblades and vibroswords.
Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.
Dugs reach adulthood in their early teens and live an average of 75 years. Their violent nature often leads to violent ends.
Dugs' angry nature causes them to tend toward the dark side, though there are exceptions.
You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.
Your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d4]] kinetic damage and have the finesse property.

When you damage a creature with an attack or a power and the creature's size is larger than yours, you can cause the attack or power to deal extra damage to the creature. The extra damage equals your level. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Dug.
You have proficiency in the Intimidation skill.
Your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples.
Dugs typically stand between 3 and 4 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Small.
Your base walking speed is 25 feet.
You have a climbing speed of 25 feet.

Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.
Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.
Echani reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Echani culture's emphasis on honor and combat cause them to tend towards lawful alignments, though there are exceptions.
Whenever you make a Wisdom (Insight) check against someone you know to wield the Force, you are considered to have expertise in the Insight skill.
You have proficiency in Lore and Acrobatics.

If a humanoid you can see makes a melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction to make a Wisdom (Insight) check against the target's Charisma (Deception). On a success you learn one of the following traits about that creature: it's Strength, Dexterity or Constitution score; bonus to Strength, Dexterity or Constitution saving throws; armor class; or current hit points. On a failure, the target becomes immune to this feature for one day. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses on a long rest.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and one extra language of your choice.
You have proficiency in light armor, and gain proficiency with two martial vibroweapons of your choice.
Echani stand between 5 and a half and 6 feet tall and weigh around 150 lbs, with little variation between them. Your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d6]] kinetic damage and have the finesse property.
Your Strength or Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.
Esh-kha reach adulthood in their early teens and live less than a century.
The esh-kha's stubborn and racially-centric mindsets cause them to tend toward lawful balanced, though there are exceptions.

You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
You know your choice of the turbulence, force disarm, or slow at-will force powers. Your forcecasting ability is Wisdom or Charisma (depending on power alignment).
You have proficiency in the Investigation skill.

You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Kharan. Kharan contains many metaphorical expressions when translated to Galactic Basic. The language has many comparisons to music and singing, such as a galactic government being compared to a chorus.
When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.
Esh-kha typically stand 6 to 6 and a half feet tall and generally weigh about 200 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You have proficiency in two vibroweapons or blasters of your choice.
Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.
Falleen reach adulthood in their late teens and live up to 250 years.
Falleen societal structure causes them to tend to be lawful balanced, though there are exceptions.
Falleen brains have an unusual composition which make them resistant to influence from the Force. You have advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws against force powers.

You can use your pheromones to influence individuals of both sexes. Whenever you roll a 1 on a Charisma (Persuasion) check, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll. Additionally, once per short or long rest, you can treat a [[/r d20]] roll of 9 or lower on a Charisma check as a 10. This feature has no effect on droids or constructs.
You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour at a time.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Falleen. Falleen is characterized by its common use of the Z and X sounds, of which the Falleen are fond.
You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.
Falleen typically stand between 5 and 6 feet tall and weigh around 165 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.
Felucians reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Felucians' connection to the Living Force causes them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.
You can breathe air and water.

You know the burst at-will force power. When you reach 3rd level, you learn and can cast the beast trick force power once per day. When you reach 5th level, you learn and can cast the plant surge force power once per day. Wisdom is your forcecasting ability for these powers.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic, Felucianese, and one more language of your choice. Felucianese is characterized by guttural, whisper-like vowels, interspersed with hard clicks.
You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.
Felucians typically stand over 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 200 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You are proficient in the Stealth skill.
Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Wisdom or Charisma score increases by 1.
Flesh raiders reach adulthoood by 20 and rarely live longer than 90 years.
As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward an enemy of your choice that you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.
Flesh raiders' propensity towards war and aggression cause them to tend toward chaotic dark side, though there are exceptions.

If you spend at least 1 minute devouring the corpse of a beast or humanoid, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of one). Once you've used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Due to their unique physiology, flesh raider hardiness allows them to overcome use of the Force. You have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws against force powers.
Whenever you make a Wisdom (Survival) check to hunt for food, you are considered to have expertise in the Survival skill.

You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Rakata. Rakata is characterized by its deep tones and simplistic nature, using mainly consonants and long vowels. It's script seems to be a very ancient form of Galactic Basic.
You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.
Flesh raiders typically stand between 6 and 7 feet tall and weigh around 200 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.
Gand reach adulthood when they earn their name, which is usually in their teens, and live to be about 70 on average.
Gand tend toward no particular alignment. The best and worst are found among them.
You have a thick exoskeleton. While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 12 + your Dexterity modifier.
You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage (explained in chapter 9).

You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Gand. The Gand language does not use pronouns as Gand refer to themselves in the third person, so often Gand who speak Galactic Basic are difficult to understand.
Gand do not have lungs, and therefore do not need to breathe.
When you take damage, you can use your reaction and expend a Hit Die to regain hit points as long as the damage would not reduce your hit points to 0.
Gand stand 4 to 6 feet tall and weigh around 100 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Dexterity or Charisma score increases by 1.
Ganks reach adulthood in their late teens and live for slightly more than a century thanks to their cybernetics.
As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward an enemy of your choice that you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.
Ganks aggressive and hair trigger nature causes them to tend towards chaotic dark side, though there are exceptions.
You have proficiency in the Athletics skill.
You have proficiency in light and medium armor as well as two vibroweapons or blasters of your choice.

You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Gank. You can communicate with other ganks within 30 feet without speaking through use of cybernetic implants. Tech casters can detect the communication but cant understand it.
You have proficiency in one of the following skills: Intimidation, Persuasion, Stealth, or Perception.
Ganks typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 160 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 35 feet. You ignore the strength property of heavy armor.
You Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Constitution or Intelligence score increases by 1.
Geonosians reach adulthood at 10 and live less than a century.
Geonosians' greedy and self-serving nature causes them to tend toward the dark side, though there are exceptions.
Geonosian culture promotes artisanry. You have proficiency in one set of artisan's implements of your choice.
You have a thick exoskeleton. While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 12 + your Dexterity modifier.
You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. While wearing medium or heavy armor, your flying speed is reduced by half.
You have proficiency in blasters that deal sonic damage.

You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Geonosian. The Geonosian language consists of click consonants through use of a Geonosians' dual mandibles. This makes it difficult for other species to learn to speak it.
Geonosians typically stand from 5 to 6 feet tall and rarely weigh more than 80 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.
Givin reach adulthood in their early teens and live about 80 years.
Givins believe power and respect are earned rather than expected, causing them to tend towards balanced alignments, though there are exceptions.
You have a tough, bony exterior. While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Givin. Givin is characterized by its use of mathematical jargon and symbols, making it nigh incomprehensible to the less mathematically inclined.
Whenever you make an Intelligence (Technology) check involving mathematics, you are considered to have expertise in the Technology skill.
Givin typically stand around 6 feet tall and weigh 150 lb. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You have proficiency in Piloting and Technology.
You can survive for one day within the vacuum of space. You still require oxygen to breathe. You have resistance to cold damage.
Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.
Their innate understanding of technology allow gormak to readily adapt to its effects. You have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws against tech powers.
Gormaks reach adulthood in their late teens and live for more than a century.
As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward an enemy of your choice that you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.
Gormaks' warlike nature causes them to tend toward the dark side, though there are exceptions.
Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d4]] kinetic damage.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Gormak. Gormak is primitive and gruff, often lacking definitions for things found outside of their homeworld.
Gormaks typically stand 5 and a half to 6 and a half feet tall and generally weigh about 150 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

You have proficiency in the Technology skill, one vibroweapon and one blaster of your choice, and your choice of armstech's implements, biotech's implements, constructor's implements, mechanic's kits, or tinker's implements. Additionally, you have advantage on Intelligence (Technology) checks made to understand, utilize, or modify technology that you are unaware of or have never seen before.
Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and one other ability score of your choice increases by 1.
Gotals reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Gotals' polite and respectful nature causes them to tend toward lawful alignments, though there are exceptions.

Gotals perceive the environment around them through use of electromagnetic sensors held in their cranial horns. You have blindsight out to 30 feet. If another trait would grant you blindsight, the range is increased by half as many feet.
You are proficient in Survival.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Antarian. The Antarian language is characterized by growls and clicking noises at various volumes.

Gotal's electromagnetic sensors allow them to sense the emotions in those around them. You have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks to determine emotions against humanoids and beasts within 10 feet of you.
Gotals typically stand 6 to 7 feet tall and generally weigh about 150 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.
Gran reach adulthood around their late teens and live up to 80 years.
Gran highly organized society cause them to tend toward lawful alignments, though there are exceptions..
Through use of infrared vision, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Gran. It is rare to hear Gran spoken on any world other than Kinyen.
Through identifying subtle variations in a target's body heat, the Gran are able to better understand their emotions and intentions. You are proficient in the Insight skill.
Gran typically stand between 5 and 6 feet tall and weigh around 170 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
You are able to go a number of days without food equal to 3 + twice your Constitution modifier before suffering exhaustion.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

Half-humans gain the ability score increases of their non-human half, but they can choose any ability score for one of the options, instead of the given option. Half-humans can not increase the same ability score twice during character creation using this feature.
Half-humans live around the average of the two species' lifespans.
Half-humans tend towards their non-human half's alignment.

Half-humans are known to be stubborn and often refuse to give up, even against the worst odds. When you or a creature you can see that can see and understand you makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can roll a [[/r d4]] and add it to their roll (no action required). You can use this before or after the roll, but before the GM determines the roll's outcome. Once you've used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic, regardless of whether or not the non-human half can speak it, and the language(s) associated with your non-human half.
Half-humans stand and weigh around the average of the two species' height and weight. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is the size of your non-human half.
Your base walking speed is that of your non-human half.
Your Strength, Constitution, and Intelligence scores increase by 1.
Harch reach adulthood at age 10 and can live up to 200 years.
Harch are cold, calculating beings, causing them to tend toward the dark side, though there are exceptions.

Your fangs are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d4]] kinetic damage. Lastly, as a bonus action, you can perform a special bite attack. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects, and it must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, the target is poisoned until the end of its next turn, and you can't use this feature again until you complete a short or long rest.

You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Harchese. Harchese is discernible from other insectoid languages by a noticeable emphasis on consonants, especially the "ch" sound.

Harch have six arms which they can use independently of one another. You can only gain the benefit of items held by two of your arms at any given time, and once per round you can switch which arms you are benefiting from (no action required).
Harch stand around 6 feet tall and weigh between 200 and 300 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You have a climbing speed of 30 feet. You have advantage on Strength saving throws and Strength (Athletics) checks that involve climbing, and while climbing you always have two hands free.
Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.
Herglic reach adulthood in their late teens and live up to 120 years.
Herglics' gentle nature causes them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.
You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour at a time.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Herglese. Herglese has a clear and commanding cadence, drawing the attention of those who hear it.
Your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples.
Herglic stand between 6 and 8 feet tall and weigh up to 600 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.
You are proficient in the Technology skill.
Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.
Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.
Ho'din reach adulthood in their early 30s and live up to 120 years.
Ho'dins' benevolent nature causes them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.
You have proficiency with Medicine or Survival (your choice).
You have disadvantage on Constitution saving throws made to avoid exhaustion due to extreme cold.
You have proficiency with one artisan's implements of your choice.

You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic, and Ho'Din. Ho'Din consists of croaks and hisses. Its written form includes characters derived from the shapes of Moltok flora. The Ho'Din lexicon includes a great amount of plant-based idioms and metaphors.
You have proficiency in the Nature skill.
Growing up in the rain forests of Moltok has left an impact. You don't treat forest terrain as difficult terrain.
Whenever you make a Wisdom (Perception) check related to sensing heat, you are considered to have expertise in the Perception skill.
When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.
Ho'din are taller than most species, typically standing 8 to 10 feet tall and generally weighing about 275 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You have a climbing speed of 30 feet. You have advantage on Strength saving throws and Strength (Athletics) checks that involve climbing.
Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.
Houk reach adulthood in their late teens and live for about 80 years.
Most houk are short-tempered and deceitful, causing them to tend toward the dark side, though there are exceptions.
You have proficiency in the Stealth skill.

You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Houkese. Houkese is mainly formed by grunts, with subtle tonal inflections to differentiate words that would otherwise sound the same. Written Houkese uses primitive ideograms with one letter to represent each simple verb, and complex pictograms to represent nouns.
Your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples.
Houk typically stand 6 to 8 feet tall and generally weigh about 300 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
If you surprise a creature and hit it with an attack on your first turn in combat, the attack deals an extra [[/r 2d6]] damage to it. You can use this trait only once per combat.
Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.
Your Constitution score increases by 2, and two other ability scores of your choice increase by 1.
Hutts are considered a child until around the age of 200 in which they are a full fledged adult. Hutts can live upwards of 900 years with even more ancient ones exceeding that.
Hutts are selfish, greedy, and highly organized, causing them to tend toward chaotic dark side, though there are exceptions.
Hutt brains have an unusual composition which made them resistant to influence from the Force. You have advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws against force powers.

You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Huttese. Hutts rarely speak Galactic Basic, even though they are perfectly able; if the person with whom they are speaking doesn't understand Huttese, they are more likely to use an interpretor than deign to speak the language of lesser species.
You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage (explained in chapter 9).
Your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples.
You have supreme control over your tail and can use it to manipulate objects as well as your hands.
You have proficiency in two Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma skills of your choice.

Hutts have a unique special characteristic; from birth to death, they never stop growing. As an adolescent hutt, you typically stand between 6 and 7 feet tall and weigh at least 400 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Hutts are slow and generally incapable of moving quickly. You have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and when determining your bonus to AC from your Dexterity, you can't add more than +3.
Your base walking speed is 20 feet.
During character creation, you start with additional credits equal to your level x your proficiency bonus x 1,000 cr.
Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Strength score increases by 1.
Iktotchi reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Iktotchi are lawful and tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.
Your horns are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d6]] kinetic damage.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Iktotchese.
You have proficiency in the Piloting skill.

You can see brief fragments of the future, that allow you to turn failures into successes. When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.
Iktotchi typically stand between 5 and 6 feet tall and weigh about 170 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You can communicate telepathically with creatures within 30 feet of you. You must share a language with the target in order to communicate in this way.
Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.
Kage reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Kages' rigid sense of honor causes them to tend toward lawful light side, though there are exceptions.
You are proficient in Animal Handling.
You have proficiency in the Athletics skill.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and one language of your choice.
Kage typically stand between 5 and 6 feet tall, and weigh around 150 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

When you make a long jump, you can cover a number of feet up to twice your Strength score. When you make a high jump, you can leap a number of feet up into the air equal to 3 + twice your Strength modifier.
You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

You've lived most of your life without direct sunlight. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d4]] kinetic damage and have the finesse property.
Kage are adept warriors. You are proficient with the electroprod and electrostaff.
Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.
Kaleesh reach adulthood in their early teens and live to be about 80.
Kaleesh tend toward no particular alignment. The best and worst are found among them.

The thermal pits under a Kaleesh's eyes grant darkvision. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Kaleesh.
Kaleesh typically stand about five and a half feet tall and weigh about 140 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You have proficiency in the Survival skill. Additionally, you are considered to have expertise in Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track a creature if that creature has a scent.
Kaleesh are adept hunters. You are proficient with the blaster carbine, vibroblade, vibropike, and, vibrospear.
Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.
Kallerans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Kallerans' individualistic society causes them to tend towards chaotic alignments, though there are exceptions.
You can breathe air and water.
You have advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks that involve flexibility.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that involve hearing.

You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Kall. Kall depends upon distinct antenna movements communicate correctly. This leads to this characteristic antenna movement when kallerans speak Galactic Basic. Because antenna movement is an integral part of Kall, it is difficult for most other species to master.
You have supreme control over your feet and can use them to manipulate objects as well as your hands.
Kallerans typically stand 6 and a half to 8 feet tall and generally weigh about 150 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Through your antenna, you can sense incoming danger and react accordingly. When you roll for initiative, you can choose to gain advantage on the roll. Alternatively, if you are surprised, you may act normally on your first turn. Once you've used this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.
Your Intelligence score increases by 2 and your Wisdom score increases by 1.
Kaminoans reach adulthood at 11 years old and live around 100 years.
Kaminoans highly organized society lead individuals to tend toward a lawful alignment, though there are exceptions.
You have proficiency in the Medicine skill.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Kaminoan. Kaminoan is characterized by its flowing water-like sound.
When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.
Kaminoans typically stand 7 to 8 feet tall and weigh around 150 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You know the temporary boost at-will tech power. Your techcasting ability is Intelligence. You do not require use of a wristpad for this power.
Whenever you make a Wisdom (Perception) check related to sight, you are considered to have expertise in the Perception skill.
Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Strength score increases by 1.
Kakarodon reach adulthood in their early teens and live to be about 70.
As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward an enemy of your choice that you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.
Karkarodons' warmongering nature causes them to tend toward the dark side, though there are exceptions
You can breathe air and water.

Your sharp teeth are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d6]] kinetic damage. Lastly, as a bonus action, you can perform a special bite attack. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), and you can't use this trait again until you finish a short or long rest.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Karkaran. Karkaran is characterized by its fierce sounds.
Karkarodons stand 5 to 7 feet tall and weigh upwards of 250 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.
Your Strength or Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Wisdom or Charisma score increases by 1.
Kiffar reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Kiffar are independent and free spirited, causing them to tend towards chaotic alignments, though there are exceptions.
You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed.

A small percentage of the kiffar population are naturally Force-sensitive, able to read the memories contained within inanimate objects, while others train to become proud guardians of their home sector. You choose one of the following heritages:
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and one extra language of your choice. Kiffar never had a tongue to call their own, using Galactic Basic as far back as their history goes.
Kiffar are naturally adapted to avoiding the Force. You have advantage on Dexterity and Intelligence saving throws against force powers.
Kiffar vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You have proficiency with two vibroweapons of your choice.
Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.
Killiks reach adulthood in their 40s and live an average of 200 years.
Killiks' willingness to brainwash or kill their enemies cause them to tend towards the dark side, though there are exceptions.

Killiks have four arms which they can use independently of one another. You can only gain the benefit of items held by two of your arms at any given time, and once per round you can switch which arms you are benefiting from (no action required).
While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.
You can speak, read, and write Killik. You can understand spoken and written Galactic Basic, but your vocal cords do not allow you to speak it.
Killiks stand between 5 and 6 feet tall and weigh about 160 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

When you make a long jump, you can cover a number of feet up to twice your Strength score. When you make a high jump, you can leap a number of feet up into the air equal to 3 + twice your Strength modifier.
You can communicate telepathically with creatures within 30 feet of you. You must share a language with the target in order to communicate in this way.
Your Strength, Constitution, and Wisdom scores increase by 1.
Klatooinians reach adulthood in their late teens and can live as long as 90 standard years.
Klatooinian society encourages reverence for tradition and an inclination towards violence, causing them to tend toward lawful dark side, though there are exceptions.
You are proficient in the Intimidation skill. When you take the Help action to give an ally advantage on an Intimidation check, they gain a bonus to the roll equal to your proficiency bonus.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic, Klatooinian, and Huttese. Klatooinian is a gutteral, barking language, with many loanwords adopted from Huttese over the centuries.
Klatooinians typically stand around 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 170 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.
Klatooinians are trained to fight from a young age. You have proficiency in two martial vibroweapons of your choice.
You are proficient in the Lore skill.
Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.
Kubaz reach adulthood in their early teens and live less than a century.
Kubaz' courteous nature causes them to tend toward lawful alignments, though there are exceptions.

Whenever you make an ability check related to the acquisition or location of art or valuables, you are considered proficient in the check. If you would already be proficient, you instead have expertise.

You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
You have proficiency in one of the following skills: Deception, Sleight of Hand, or Stealth.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Kubazian. Kubazian is comprised of a unique series of whirring, nasally syllables, causing Kubaz to have a high-pitched accent when speaking other languages.
Kubaz typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and weigh around 160 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
You have proficiency with the Technology skill and the slicer's kit.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.
Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.
Kushibans reach adulthood at 13 and live less than a century.
Kushibans' playful nature causes them to tend toward chaotic light side, though there are exceptions.

As an action on your turn, you can cower pathetically to distract nearby foes. Until the end of your next turn, your allies gain advantage on attack rolls against enemies within 10 feet of you that can see you. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

You have a thick hide. While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 12 + your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, your thick hide is naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Kushiban. Kushiban has a bubbly, joyful tone to it.
You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

Your reflexes and agility allow you to move with a burst of speed. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.
Kushibans typically stand 3 and a half to 4 feet tall and weigh around 40 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Small.
Your base walking speed is 25 feet.
You are proficient in the Stealth skill.

Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.
Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.
Kyuzo reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Kyuzos' belief in justice and honor cause them to tend toward lawful balanced, though there are exceptions.

Your natural evolution allows you to see what others do not in dim and dark conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Kyuzo struggle in atmospheres other than those of Phatrong. You wear a filter mask, and if your mask is removed while you are in such an environment, you lose consciousness.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Kyuzo. Kyuzo is characterized by short words and quick phrases. Kyuzo struggle with Galactic Basic as it is grammatically dissimilar to Kyuzo.
When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.
Kyuzo typically stand between 6 and 7 feet tall and weigh around 170 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

When you make a long jump, you can cover a number of feet up to twice your Strength score. When you make a high jump, you can leap a number of feet up into the air equal to 3 + twice your Strength modifier.
Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.
Lanniks reach adulthood in their 100's and can live up to 900 years.
Despite the turbulence on their homeworld, Lanniks tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.
Lanniks have a natural attunement for the Force, which makes them resistant to its powers. You have advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws against force powers.

You know the guidance at-will force power. When you reach 3rd level, you learn and can cast the valor force power once per day. When you reach 5th level, you learn and can cast the force enlightenment force power once per day. Wisdom is your forcecasting ability for these powers.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Lannik. Due to their large ears, the Lannik language is spoken softly, and it is considered insulting to shout.
Lanniks typically stand 3 to 4 feet tall and rarely weigh more than 50 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Small.
Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.
You are proficient in the Lore skill.
Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.
Lasats reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Lasat' honorable tendences cause them to tend toward lawful light side, though there are exceptions.
You have proficiency with blaster rifles, bo-rifles, and vibrostaffs.
You have a climbing speed of 30 feet.

Your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Lasat, a language whose r's are difficult to replicate by most other species.
Your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples.
Lasats tower over other species, averaging 7 feet tall and weighing over 200 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.
Lurmen reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than 80 years.
The pacifistic nature of the lurmen causes them to be neutral light side, though there are exceptions.

You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Lurmese. Lurmese is a name collectively given to the various tribal languages spoken by the lurmen people. While each language is distinct, shared phrases allow translation between dialects.
You have proficiency in the Medicine and Nature skills, and the bioanalysis kit.
You have supreme control over your tail and feet and can use them to manipulate objects as well as your hands.

As a lurmen, you can run on all fours, or curl into a ball, to move quickly along the ground. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.
Lurmen typically stand around 3 feet tall and generally weigh about 45 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Small.
Your base walking speed is 25 feet.
You have a climbing speed of 25 feet. You have advantage on Strength saving throws and Strength (Athletics) checks that involve climbing.

Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.
Your Constitution increases by 2, and your Strength increases by 1.
Massassi live relatively short lives. They reach adulthood after 14 years, and reach old age around 40 years of life.
The massassi are savage and brutish warriors who relish on the violence of combat, usually following a dark and chaotic nature.

Your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You cant discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
When you reach 3rd level, you can cast your choice of the curse, dun moch, or hex force power once per day. Your forcecasting ability is Charisma.
You have a thick hide. While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Sith. Sith is an agglutinative language, in which words or even phrases were made up of linear sequences of distinct meaningful units.

Lightweapons and vibroweapons that lack the dexterity or light property are considered to have the heavy property for you. The strength number for blasters is reduced by one step (from 19 to 17, 17 to 15, 15 to 13, or 13 to 11). If the strength number is 11, you ignore it entirely.
Your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples.
Massassi are between 7 and 8 feet tall and weigh between 200 and 300 pounds. Your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your creature type is both aberration and humanoid.
Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and one other ability score of your choice increases by 1.
Mikkian reach adulthood in their late teens and live a little over a century.
Mikkian's honor and integrity based culture causes them to tend toward lawful alignments, though there are exceptions.
Mikkian can perceive the world around them through heat and radiation. You have blindsight out to 30 feet. If another trait would grant you blindsight, the range is increased by half as many feet.
You have proficiency with Persuasion or Intimidation (your choice).
Your head-tendrils provide a keen awareness of your surroundings. You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that involve hearing.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Mikkian. Mikkian is a melodic, flowing tongue made up of several ancient dialects.
Mikkian typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 120 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.
Miraluka reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Miraluka believe in balance and thus tend toward no particular alignment. The best and worst are found among them.
Miraluka perceive the environment around them through use of the Force. You are constantly under the effects of the force power force sight, though the power does not require concentration for you.

You know the mind trick at-will force power. When you reach 3rd level, you learn and can cast the sanctuary force power once per day. When you reach 5th level, you learn and can cast the force confusion power once per day. Wisdom or Charisma (your choice) is your forcecasting ability for these powers.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Miralukese.
Miraluka typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 150 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.
Mirialan reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Mirialans spiritual tendencies cause them to tend towards the light side, though there are exceptions.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Mirialan.
Mirialan typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and weight 150 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 35 feet.
You have proficiency in Lore. Additionally, you are considered to have expertise in Intelligence (Lore) checks made to learn or recall something about a culture's religion.
If you surprise a creature and hit it with an attack on your first turn in combat, the attack deals an extra [[/r 2d6]] damage to it. You can use this trait only once per combat.
Your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d4]] kinetic damage and have the finesse property.
Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Strength or Dexterity score increases by 1.
Mustafarians reach adulthood in their late teens and live about 80 years.
Mustafarians are usually judicious and value good work above all else, causing them to be lawful balanced, though there are exceptions.

As an originally cave-dwelling species, your eyes are adapted to the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
You have a thick hide. While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 12 + your Dexterity modifier.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Mustafarian. Mustafarian consists of choppy clicks and emphatic groans.

Your body is well accustomed to extreme heat, giving you resistance to fire damage. Additionally, your thick hide is naturally adapted to hot climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

You have proficiency in your choice of constructor's implements, scavenging kit, or surveyor's implements. Additionally, whenever you make an Intelligence (Nature) check to identify a metal or mineral, you are considered to have expertise in the Nature skill.
Mustafarians stand between 5 and 7 feet tall and weigh around 165 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet. You ignore the strength property of heavy armor.
Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.
Muuns reach adulthood in their late teens and live an average of a century.
Muuns' lawful culture nature causes them to tend toward lawful balanced, though there are exceptions.

Muun share a keen business sense and an ability to find value where others don't. Whenever you make a Charisma (Persuasion) check involving finances you are considered to have expertise in the Persuasion skill.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Muun. The Muuns' admiration of mathematics carries over into their language, which bares a striking resemblance to Binary.
When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.
Muuns typically stand 6 and a half to 7 feet tall and weigh around 200 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.
Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.
Neimoidians reach adulthood in their 20s and live about 150 years.
Neimoidians' greedy nature causes them to tend toward the dark side, though there are exceptions.
You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

As an action on your turn, you can cower pathetically to distract nearby foes. Until the end of your next turn, your allies gain advantage on attack rolls against enemies within 10 feet of you that can see you. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Pak Pak. Pak Pak is often considered an elegant-sounding language by those who hear it. It consists of husky sighs and guttural ululations.
Neimoidians typically stand around 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 135 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
You have proficiency in Deception and Persuasion.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
During character creation, you start with additional credits equal to your level x your proficiency bonus x 1,000 cr.
Your Constitution score increases by 2, and one other ability score of your choice increases by 1.

The frequent radiation bursts from the nearby dying star caused the nikto to mutate and adapt into different subspecies over time, specialized for different environments. Choose one of the following adaptations:
Nikto reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Nikto's self-sufficient and clever nature causes them to tend toward balanced alignments, though there are exceptions.
You have a thick hide. While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic, Nikto, and Huttese. Nikto is spoken with sharp syllables with a deep and rumbling cadence.
You have advantage on saving throws against being blinded.
The dying star nearby their homeworld makes nikto naturally used to radiation. You have resistance to necrotic damage.
Nikto typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 150 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Strength score increases by 1.
Noghri reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Noghri's honorable society causes them to tend toward a lawful alignment, though there are exceptions.
You are proficient in Survival and Stealth.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Honorghran. Honorghran is characterized by its scratchy, gutteral sounds.

If you jump at least 10 feet in a straight line before hitting with a melee weapon attack, you can attempt to trip the target prone as part of the same attack. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Noghri typically stand about 5 feet tall and weigh around 150 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

When you make a long jump, you can cover a number of feet up to twice your Strength score. When you make a high jump, you can leap a number of feet up into the air equal to 3 + twice your Strength modifier.
Your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d4]] kinetic damage and have the finesse property.
Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.
Nothoiin reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Nothoiins tend toward no particular alignment. The best and worst are found among them.
Nothoiins demonstrate seemingly innate piloting abilities from a very young age. You have proficiency in the Piloting skill.
You are considered to have expertise in Wisdom (Survival) checks made to navigate.
You have proficiency in the Lore skill.

Whenever you make a Dexterity ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can choose to add [[/r 1d4]] to the result. You can use this before or after the roll, but before the GM determines the roll's outcome. Once you've used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and one language of your choice. You can also communicate via Notho, a native hand language developed by hunters living in the Nothoiin plains. Usage of Notho is exceedingly rare outside Nothoiin culture.
Nothoiins have intimate knowledge of ur-diamond mining and refinement practices. You gain proficiency in your choice of jeweler's implements, scavenging kit, or archaeologist kit.
Nothoiins typically stand between 5 and 6 feet tall and weigh 150 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Whenever you make an Intelligence (Technology) check related to starships, you are considered to have expertise in the Technology skill.
Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.
Ortolans are considered adults at the age of seven and typically live less than a century.
Ortolans' love of food and music causes them to tend toward chaotic light side, though there are exceptions.
Whenever you make a Wisdom (Survival) check to forage for food you are considered to have expertise in the Survival skill.

As an action on your turn, you can cower pathetically to distract nearby foes. Until the end of your next turn, your allies gain advantage on attack rolls against enemies within 10 feet of you that can see you. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Your thick hide is naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that involve hearing or smell.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Ortolan. Ortolan is characterized by its grunts and hoots.
You have proficiency in Performance and one musical instrument of your choice.
Ortolans stand around 3 to 4 feet tall and weigh about 55 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Small.
Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.
Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.
Pa'lowick reach adulthood in their late teens and live about 75 years.
Pa'lowick enjoy a raucous good time, causing them to tend toward chaotic light side, though there are exceptions.
Pa'lowick have a great lung capacity and can hold their breath for up to 15 minutes at a time.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Lowickese. Lowickese requires the user to purse their lips and blow air, and is considered amusing by other species.

Pa'lowick are best known for the energy they can bring to a singing performance. Whenever you make a Charisma (Performance) check involving singing, you are considered to have expertise in the Performance skill.
Pa'lowick stand about 5 feet tall, and weigh approximately 100 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

You have supreme control over your snout and can use it to manipulate objects as well as your hands. Additionally, your snout is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d4]] kinetic damage.

As an action, you can violently expel air in a 15-foot cone. When you do so, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). A creature takes [[/r 2d6]] sonic damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to [[/r 4d6]] at 5th level, [[/r 6d6]] at 11th level, and [[/r 8d6]] at 17th level. This ability has no effect on constructs. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you complete a long rest.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.
Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Intelligence or Wisdom score increases by 1.
Pantorans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Pantorans' interest in politics causes them to tend towards lawful alignments, though there are exceptions.
You have advantage on Constitution saving throws made to avoid exhaustion due to extreme cold.
You have proficiency in the Lore skill.

As a bonus action, you can command each ally within 15 feet of you to move up to half that ally's speed as a reaction. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity. Once you use this trait, you cant use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Pantoran. Pantoran comprises many dialects that prevent clear communication, a vestige of the feudal culture of the planet's past. Because of the difficulties of operating a planetary government with so many different languages, the Assembly established Galactic Basic as the official language of their people as a means of unifying the planet.
You have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks meant to negotiate terms or agreements between parties.

Your society values organization, and as such you are good at making good use of the space provided. When you are in charge of packing a space, such as a vehicle or cargo hold, that space's carrying capacity is increased by one-fourth its base capacity.
You are proficient in Persuasion or Deception (your choice).
Pantorans typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 150 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Dexterity or Charisma score increases by 1.
Patrolians reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Patrolians' greedy, scheming nature causes them to tend toward the dark side, though there are exceptions.
You can breathe air and water.
You have proficiency in Deception or Stealth (your choice).

Accustomed to life underwater, you have superior vision in low light conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Patrolians are notably capable of shrugging off electricity. You have resistance to lightning damage.

You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Patrolian. Patrolian is a high-energy language, consisting mostly of gurgles and skittish vocalizations. Patrolian, even when spoken on land, sounds like it's being spoken underwater.
Patrolians typically stand just over 3 feet tall and generally weigh about 40 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Small.
You have proficiency in one specialist's kit of your choice.
Your base walking speed is 25 feet.
You have a swimming speed of 25 feet.
You are proficient in the Technology skill.

Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.
Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.
Pau'ans reach adulthood in their 30's and have been known to live up to 700 years old.
Pau'ans' commanding presence, yet friendly and kind nature, cause them to tend to be lawful light side, though there are exceptions.
You have proficiency in Persuasion or Intimidation (your choice).
You have proficiency in the Lore skill.

You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

Pau'ans possess incredibly receptive hearing, often to their detriment, so you wear special covers on your ears. Whenever you make a Wisdom (Perception) check involving hearing, you are considered to have expertise in the Perception skill, but if your hearing aids are removed, you have disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal sonic damage.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Utapese. Utapese is characterized by its rigid, yet melodic sound.
Pau'ans typically stand between 6 and 7 feet tall and generally weigh about 150 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You can choose to have advantage on your next Initiative check. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.
Pykes reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Due to their underhanded nature, Pykes tend toward the dark side, though there are exceptions.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Pyke. The Pyke language is characterized by its multisyllable grunts.
When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.
You have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Deception, Persuasion, or Intimidation.

Whenever you make an ability check related to the buying, selling, or controlling of slaves, you are considered proficient in the check. If you would already be proficient, you instead have expertise.
Pykes typically stand 6 to 6 and a half feet tall and generally weigh about 155 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You are proficient in spicer's kit.
Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.
Quarren reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Quarren desire for equal rights causes them to tend toward balanced, though there are exceptions.
You can breathe air and water.
You have a climbing speed of 30 feet.
You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

As an action, you can expel ink in a 10-foot cone. When you do so, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, a creature is blinded until the end of its next turn. This ability has no effect on constructs. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you complete a long rest.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Quarrenese. The Quarrenese language is characterized by its garbled nature that evokes an image of speaking underwater.
Quarren typically stand between 5 and 6 feet tall and weigh about 160 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.
Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.
Quermians reach adulthood in their early teens and live a little under a century.
Querians philosophic culture causes them to tend toward light alignments, though there are exceptions.
You have proficiency with Insight or Persuasion (your choice).

Quermians have four arms which they can use independently of one another. You can only gain the benefit of items held by two of your arms at any given time, and once per round you can switch which arms you are benefiting from (no action required).

You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Quermian. You can also communicate with other quermians more effectively through a thorough understanding of body language that xenobiologists widely attribute to latent telepathy.

Quermians' talent at reading the body language of others allow them to sense the emotions in those around them. You have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks to determine emotions against humanoids and beasts within 10 feet of you.
Quermians typically stand 7 to 8 feet tall and generally weigh about 140 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
When you make a Wisdom saving throw, you can use your reaction to gain advantage on the roll. Once you've done so, you must complete a short or long rest before you can do so again.
You have proficiency in the Perception skill.
Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.
Prolongued use of technology allows rakata to readily adapt to its effects. You have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws against tech powers.
Rakata reach adulthoood by 20 and rarely live longer than 90 years.
Rakata's propensity towards war and aggression cause them to tend toward lawful dark side, though there are exceptions.
You can breathe air and water.
