If you spend at least 1 minute devouring the corpse of a beast or humanoid, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier. Once you've used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.
Your claws are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d6]] kinetic damage.

You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
While rakata can be manipulated by many force powers, they can not sense the Force. You can not use force powers or take levels in forcecasting classes.

You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Rakata. Rakata is characterized by its deep tones and simplistic nature, using mainly consonants and long vowels. It's script seems to be a very ancient form of Galactic Basic.
Rakata typically stand between 6 and 7 feet tall and weigh around 180 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.
You are proficient in the Technology skill.
Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Dexterity or Intelligence score increases by 1.
You have proficiency in Acrobatics.
Rattataki reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Rattataki are self-serving and violent which causes them to tend toward the dark side, though there are exceptions.
You have proficiency in Intimidation.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Rattataki. Rattataki is known for have an inordinate amount of curses.
Rattataki typically stand about 5 and a half feet tall and weigh 140 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 35 feet.
If you surprise a creature and hit it with an attack on your first turn in combat, the attack deals an extra [[/r 2d6]] damage to it. You can use this trait only once per combat.
Your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d4]] kinetic damage and have the finesse property.
Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.
Rishii reach adulthood at 10 and generally live no longer than 60 years.
Rishii tend toward no particular alignment. The best and worst are found among them.
You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. While wearing medium or heavy armor, your flying speed is reduced by half.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Rishii. Rishii's clicks, trills, and whistles are difficult for outsiders to learn without the aid of a protocol droid, and so Rishii often feel comfortable speaking to eachother in the language in front of others.

You can mimic sounds you have heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds you make can tell they are imitations with a successful Wisdom (Insight) check opposed by your Charisma (Deception) check.
Rishii range from 4 to 6 feet tall and generally weigh less than 130 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your Intelligence or Charisma score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.
Ryn reach adulthood in their early teens and live about 80 years.
Ryn's superstitious and solitary nature causes them to tend toward balanced alignments, though there are exceptions.
You have proficiency in one gaming set of your choice.
You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

Whether through mystical divination or sheer luck, you can turn failures into successes. When you roll a 1 on the [[/r d20]] for an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.
You have proficiency in Lore or Survival (your choice).

You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Ryn. Ryn uses tones and inflections and is easily described as melodious by anyone who hears it. You can communicate with droids and other ryn without using words through the use of your beak.
You have proficiency in Performance and one musical instrument of your choice.
You have supreme control over your tail and can use it to manipulate objects as well as your hands.
Ryn typically stand 4 and a half to 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 120 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.
Selkath reach adulthood in their late teens and live up to 100 years.
Selkath have been renowned for countless millenia of the careful preservation of neutrality. As such individuals tend towards the neutral balanced alignment, though there are exceptions.
You can breathe air and water.

Your claws are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d4]] kinetic damage and have the finesse property. Lastly, as a bonus action, you can perform a special claw attack. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects, and it must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, the target is poisoned until the end of its next turn, and you can't use this feature again until you complete a short or long rest.

You know the temporary boost at-will tech power. When you reach 3rd level, you learn and can cast the kolto pack tech power once per day. When you reach 5th level, you learn and can cast the kolto cloud tech power once per day. Your techcasting ability is Intelligence. You do not require use of a wristpad for these powers.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Selkatha. Selkatha has a very moist and gurgling tone to it.
Selkath typically stand between 4 and a half to 5 and a half feet tall and average 130 pounds. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.
Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Strength score increases by 1.
Selonians reach adulthood in their mid teens and live for about 75 years.
Selonians are serious and den-focused, causing them to tend towards lawful balanced, though there are exceptions.
You have a climbing speed of 35 feet.

You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You cant discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Mandaba. Selonians use the name "Home Talk" to refer to their own language.

Your reflexes and agility allow you to move with a burst of speed. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the tum. Once you use this trait, you cant use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.
Selonians typically stand 6 to 7 feet tall and generally weigh about 180 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 35 feet.
You have a swimming speed of 35 feet.
Your strong tail and razor-sharp claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d6]] kinetic damage.
Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.
Shistavanen reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Shistavanen are private and tend toward no particular alignment. The best and worst are found among them.
You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

Shistavanen are able to maintain a fast pace longer than other species. Shistavanen have advantage on Constitution saving throws made to avoid Exhaustion due to prolongued travel, as described in Chapter 8.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that involve hearing or smell.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Shistavanen. The Shistavanen language is characterized by its barks and growls.
When you take damage, you can use your reaction and expend a Hit Die to regain hit points as long as the damage would not reduce your hit points to 0.
Shistavanen typically stand around 6 feet tall and weigh between 140 and 190 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your fangs and claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d6]] kinetic damage.
Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.
Squibs reach adulthood at nine years of age and live an average of sixty-five years.
Squibs' cheerful nature causes them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.
Your sharp teeth are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d4]] kinetic damage.

A common trait of all Squibs is their desire and love of haggling. Squibs believe a deal is done when both sides believe they got the better of the other. Whenever you make a Charisma (Persuasion) check involving haggling you are considered to have expertise in the Persuasion skill.

Squibs have flexible cheeks in which they can store small goods. You can store up to two items that weigh a combined total of no more than 2 lb. in your cheeks, and you have advantage on Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks made to conceal them.
Your thick hide is naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Squibbian. The Squibbian language originated as a secret form of communication for Squibs to convey information without being understood.
Squibs' fur is exceptionally sensitive to physical details. You have advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks that rely on touch.
Squibs typically stand 3 to 3 and a half feet tall and weigh around 50 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Small.
Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.
Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.
Ssi-ruuk reach adulthood in their early teens and live to between 100 and 120 years.
Ssi-ruuk's cultural drive to enslave and entech others cause them to tend toward the dark side, though there are exceptions.
While Ssi-ruuk can be manipulated by many force powers, they can not sense the Force. You can not use force powers or take levels in forcecasting classes.
You are proficient in Survival.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Ssi-ruuvi. Ssi-ruuvi is a language of musical whistles, honks and clicks, and is nigh impossible for humans and similar species to speak.
Ssi-ruuk have scent-tongues that let them read the emotions of individuals. You have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks to determine emotions against humanoids and beasts within 10 feet of you.
Ssi-ruuk typically stand between 6 or 7 feet tall and weigh over 300 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 35 feet.
You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.
You have tough, scaly skin and prefer not to wear clothes. While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.
Your fangs and claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d6]] kinetic damage.
Your creature type is both beast and humanoid.
Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.
Sullustan reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Sullustans' outgoing and friendly nature cause them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.
You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic, Sullestese, and one more language of your choice. Sullestese is characterized as a robust language in business, and as such is commonly learned by professional merchants.
Whenever you make a Charisma (Persuasion) check related to conducting business, you are considered to have expertise in the Persuasion skill.
You have proficiency in Piloting.
Sullustans typically stand 4 and a half to 5 feet tall and weigh around 120 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.
Talz reach adulthood at 10 and rarely live longer than 50 years.
Talz' peaceful and slow-to-anger nature cause them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.

Your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

You have a thick hide. While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 12 + your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, your thick hide is naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

You can speak, read, and write Talzzi. You can understand spoken and written Galactic Basic, but your vocal cords do not allow you to speak it. Talzzi is characterized by its high-pitched chirps and buzzes.
When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.
Talz stand between 6 and 8 feet tall and weigh around 250 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.
Tarasins reach adulthood at 10 and live less than 80 years.
Tarasins' curious yet composed nature causes them to tend toward balanced alignments, though there are exceptions.

Your scales are translucent, allowing your color-shifting skin to help you blend into your surroundings. You have proficiency in the Stealth skill. Additionally, you can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.
Growing up in the jungles of Cularin has left an impact. You don't treat jungle terrain as difficult terrain.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Tarasinese. You can communicate non-verbally with other tarasins through use of a complex system of skin color changes.
You have proficiency in the Nature skill.

Tarasins have short spines called sa'tosin that allow them to sense the use of the Force. You are constantly under the effects of the force power sense force, though the power does not require concentration for you.
Tarasins typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 130 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Strength score increases by 1.
Taung reach adulthood at 13 and live to around 85, though they rarely live even half the length as they naturally can due to their deadly lifestyles as Mandalorians.
The taung live by the traditions and honor-bound code of the Mandalorians, making them tend towards a lawful alignment, typically balanced or dark, though there are exceptions.
Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d4]] kinetic damage.
While taung can be manipulated by the force, they cannot sense the Force. You can not use force powers or take levels in forcecasting classes.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Mando'a. Mando'a is primarily a spoken language and is very expressive with simple grammar.
You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.
When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.
Taung typically stand between 6 and 7 feet tall and weigh around 210 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You gain proficiency in one vibroweapon and one blaster of your choice.
Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.
Your Charisma score increases by 2, and two other ability scores of your choice increase by 1.
Theelin reach adulthood in their late teens and live for about 70 years.
Theelin's good-nature and positivity despite the dour state of their species causes them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.
You have proficiency in your choice of artist's implements, disguise kits, synthweaver's implements, or one musical instrument of your choice.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and one extra language of your choice.
Theelin gain unique mutations, a result of cross-breeding with other humanoids. Choose one of the following mutations.
You have proficiency in the Performance skill.
Theelin typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 140 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Strength score increases by 1.
Thisspiasians reach adulthood in their 20s and often live more than a century.
Thisspiasians' emotional composure causes them to tend toward lawful alignments, though there are exceptions.
Your claws are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d4]] kinetic damage.
You have proficiency in the Lore skill.

Thisspiasians have four arms which they can use independently of one another. You can only gain the benefit of items held by two of your arms at any given time, and once per round you can switch which arms you are benefiting from (no action required).

Your calm demeanor and control make you hard to read. Wisdom (Insight) checks made against you have disadvantage, and you have advantage on any saving throw against an effect that would read your thoughts.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Thisspiasian. Thisspiasian is a complex language characterized by its interlocking sentences and heavy use of sibilants.
You have supreme control over your tail and can use it to manipulate objects as well as your hands.
Thisspiasians typically stand 5 to 6 and a half feet tall and generally weigh about 300 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

You only need 3 hours of sleep during a long rest to gain its benefits, instead of 6. Additionally, if your long rest would be interrupted, you only need to complete the long rest instead of restarting it to gain its benefits.
Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Strength, Intelligence, or Charisma score increases by 1.
Tiss'shar reach adulthood in their early teens and live about 80 years.
Tiss'shar's moral flexibility causes them to tend towards balanced alignments, though there are exceptions.

Your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You cant discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Tiss'shar. Tiss'shar is mainly formed of hisses, shrieks, and lisping vocalizations. As a written language, it has a violent-looking calligraphy of curves and sharp lines.
You have proficiency in one of the following skills: Acrobatics, Sleight of Hand, Stealth, or Technology.
Tiss'shar typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 140 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
If you surprise a creature and hit it with an attack on your first turn in combat, the attack deals an extra [[/r 2d6]] damage to it. You can use this trait only once per combat.

Your sharp teeth and claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d6]] kinetic damage. Lastly, as a bonus action, you can perform a special bite attack. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), and you can't use this trait again until you finish a short or long rest.
Your Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution scores increase by 1.
Tognath reach adulthood by 10 and live less than a century.
Tognath are famously dedicated and hard workers, causing them to tend towards balanced alignments, though there are exceptions.
You have proficiency with one set of artisan's implements of your choice.
You have a thick exoskeleton. While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

You cannot breathe oxygen. The tognath have created a breathing apparatus to negate the negative effects of living in an oxygen rich environment, but if your mask is removed while you are in such an environment, you lose consciousness.
You can speak, read, and write Tognath. You can understand spoken and written Galactic Basic, but your vocal cords do not allow you to speak it.

You have resistance to necrotic damage, and while exposed to the vacuum of space, you can survive for a number of hours equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum 1 hour), instead of a number of rounds.

Because of their primitive nervous systems, tognath are immune to most pain, letting them shrug off major injuries. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to roll a [[/r d12]]. Add your Constitution modifier to the number rolled, and reduce the damage by that total. Once you've used this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Tognath typically stand 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 140 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Tognath vocal cords are not made for oxygen rich environments, and rely on a vocalizer to communicate effectively with other species. If your vocalizer is removed or destroyed, your voice becomes quiet and difficult to understand.
Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Dexterity or Constitution score increases by 1.
Togorian reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Togorians' rigid sense of honor causes them to tend toward lawful light side, though there are exceptions.
Your claws are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d6]] kinetic damage.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Togorese. Togorese is characterized by its deep, resonating growls.
When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

Togorians tower over almost all other species, with smaller females standing upwards of 7 feet tall and weighing 250 lbs., while males can easily reach 8 feet tall and weigh around 350 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You have proficiency in the Survival and Stealth skills.
Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.
Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.
Toydarians reach adulthood at 10 and live less than a century.
Toydarians' greedy nature causes them to tend toward chaotic balanced, though there are exceptions.

A common trait of all Toydarians is their shrewd business sense and their ability to haggle any deal. A loyal and proud people, these traits could be off-putting to outsiders, as many Toydarians in the galaxy were seen as crooks or slimy businessmen, but this was not always the case. Whenever you make a Charisma (Persuasion) check involving haggling you are considered to have expertise in the Persuasion skill.
Toydarian brains have an unusual composition which made them resistant to influence from the Force. You have advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws against force powers.
You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. While wearing medium or heavy armor, your flying speed is reduced by half.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic, Huttese, and Toydarian.
You have proficiency in two Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma skills of your choice.
Toydarians average 4 feet tall and weigh less than 50 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Small.
Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.
Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Strength score increases by 1.
Ugnaughts reach adulthood at 20 and can live to reach 200.
Ugnaughts tend toward no particular alignment. The best and worst are found among them.
Your tusks are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d6]] kinetic damage.
You have proficiency in one tool of your choice.
You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
You have resistance to acid damage.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Ugnaught. The Ugnaught language is composed of grunts, squeals, and chatters, and is difficult for other species to learn.
Ugnaughts typically stand around 4 feet and weigh about 50 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Small.
Your base walking speed is 25.

You know the mending at-will tech power. When you reach 3rd level, you learn and can cast the analyze tech power once per day. When you reach 5th level, you learn and can cast the overheat tech power once per day. Your techcasting ability is Intelligence. You do not require use of a wristpad for these powers.

You have proficiency with tinker's implements. You can use these and spend 1 hour and 100 cr worth of materials to construct a Tiny Device (AC 5, 1 hp). You can take the Use an Object action to have your device cause one of the following effects: create a small explosion, create a repeating loud noise for 1 minute, create smoke for 1 minute, cause harmless tremors for 1 minute. You can maintain a number of these devices up to your proficiency bonus at once, and a device stops functioning after 24 hours away from you. You can dismantle the device to reclaim the materials used to create it.

Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.
Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.
Ugors reach adulthood in their early teens and live about 70 years, though some live to be over 100.
Ugors are loyal to their theocratic state and see outsiders as expendable. Many follow a Lawful Balanced alignment, though there are exceptions.
You can squeeze through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide, provided you are wearing and carrying nothing. You also have advantage on ability checks you make to initiate or escape a grapple.

You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You cant discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
You have proficiency in mechanic's kits or scavenging kits (your choice).
You can speak, read and write in Galactic Basic and Ugor. Additionally, Your vocal range allows you to speak languages other species might have difficulty with.
You have resistance to poison damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against poison.

If you are not incapacitated, you can reshape your body to give yourself a head, one or two arms, one or two legs, and makeshift hands and feet, or you can revert to a limbless blob (no action required). As a bonus action, you can extrude a pseudopod that is up to 6 inches wide and 10 feet long or reabsorb it into your body. You can use this pseudopod to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour out the contents of a container. The pseudopod cant attack, activate enhanced items, or carry more than 10 pounds.
Ugors typically stand between 5 and 6 feet tall and weigh 130 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 25 feet.
Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Charisma or Wisdom score increases by 1.
Umbarans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Umbarans' desire to improve their social standing at all costs causes them to tend towards chaos, though there are exceptions
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Umbaran. Umbaran is characterized by its blending of technical jargon with informal language. It is rarely spoken off Umbara.
You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by dim light.
Umbarans typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 140 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

You've lived most of your life without direct sunlight. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

You know the ward at-will tech power. When you reach 3rd level, you learn and can cast the analyze tech power once per day. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the infiltrate tech power once per day. Intelligence is your techcasting ability for these powers. You do not require use of a wristpad for these powers.
You have proficiency in one of the following skills: Insight, Technology, Deception, or Perception.
Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.
Verpine reach adulthood in their 40's and live an average of 200 years.
Verpine's altruistic and generous nature cause them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.
You have proficiency in one tool of your choice.
While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

You can speak, read, and write Verpine. You can understand spoken and written Galactic Basic, but your vocal cords do not allow you to speak it. You can communicate with other Verpine at distances of up to a mile using your antennae.
Verpine stand between 6 and 7 feet tall and rarely weigh more than 120 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

You have tremorsense out to 30 feet. You can detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations within that radius, provided that monster and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same ground or substance. Tremorsense can't be used to detect flying or incorporeal creatures
Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.
Voss reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century. They do not reach sexual maturity until they undergo the Rite of Ardor.
As Voss culture encourages duty and emotional composure, individuals tend toward a lawful alignment, though there are exceptions.
You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of grey.

Your calm demeanor and control make you hard to read. Wisdom (Insight) checks made against you have disadvantage, and you have advantage on any saving throw against an effect that would read your thoughts.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Voss. The Voss language is characterized by it's mystic-sounding word pairings.
You have proficiency in Medicine.

You see brief visions of the future, that allow you to turn failures into successes. When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.
Voss typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 150 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You have proficiency with the blaster rifle and techblade.
Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.
Vurk reach adulthood in their 20s and live an average of 70 years.
Vurk philosophies cause them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.
You can breathe air and water.
You have proficiency in the Athletics skill.

Accustomed to life underwater, you have superior vision in low light conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Your head crest is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d6]] kinetic damage.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Semblan. Semblan has a very melodic feel and often evokes images of waterfalls to those who don't understand its meanings.
Vurks typically stand between 6 and 7 feet tall and weigh around 175 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 35 feet.
You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.
Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.
Xexto reach adulthood at 9 and live less than a century.
Despite being avid thrillseekers, xexto are calm and even tempered, tending them towards balanced alignments, though there are exceptions.
You have proficiency in one of the following skills: Acrobatics, Piloting, or Sleight of Hand.
You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

Xexto have four arms which they can use independently of one another. You can only gain the benefit of items held by two of your arms at any given time, and once per round you can switch which arms you are benefiting from (no action required).
Growing up in the rainforests of Troiken has left an impact. You dont treat jungle terrain as difficult terrain.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Xextese. Xextese is a blubbering sort of language, with many metaphors for natural phenomenon found in its vocabulary.
Whenever you make a Dexterity ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can choose to add [[/r 1d4]] to the result. You cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest.
Xexto typically stand 3 to 5 feet tall and generally weigh about 50 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Small.
Your base walking speed is 25 feet.
When you make a Wisdom saving throw, you can use your reaction to gain advantage on the roll. Once you've done so, you must complete a short or long rest before you can do so again.
You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. You have advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws that involve climbing.

Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You cant use heavy shields. Additionally, you cant use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.
Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.
Yevetha reach adulthood in their early teens and live less than a century.
As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward an enemy of your choice that you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.
Yevetha's xenophobic attitude causes them to tend toward the dark side, though there are exceptions.
Your retractable dewclaws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d6]] kinetic damage.

You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Yevethan. Yevetha are able to speak other languages, but their isolationist nature makes them tend to reject the languages of other species. Only rarely would a Yevethan speak Galactic Basic, as this would often decrease their social standing.
Whenever you make an Intelligence (Technology) check related to memorizing or duplicating mechanical readouts, you are considered to have expertise in the Technology skill.
Yevetha typically stand between 6 and 6 and a half feet tall and generally weigh about 160 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.
Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.
Zeltron reach adulthood in their late teens and live about 80 years.
Zeltron are a deeply sensual, hedonistic species, causing them to tend toward chaotic balanced or dark side alignments, though there are exceptions.
You have proficiency with Deception or Persuasion (your choice).

You can use your pheromones to influence individuals of both sexes. Whenever you roll a 1 on a Charisma (Persuasion) check, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll. Additionally, once per short or long rest, you can treat a [[/r d20]] roll of 9 or lower on a Charisma check as a 10. This feature has no effect on droids or constructs.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and one language of your choice.

Zeltron's limited telepathy allow them to sense mood shifts in those around them. You have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks to determine emotions against humanoids and beasts within 10 feet of you.
Zeltron tend to be slender and statuesque, typically standing between 5 and 6 feet tall and rarely weighing more than 150 lb. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Zeltron have two livers, which makes them adept at filtering toxins. You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage (explained in chapter 9).
Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and two other ability scores of your choice increase by 1.
Zilkin are considered adults at 4 years old, and rarely live to be over 12.
Zilkin have an outspoken but just nature that causes them to tend towards lawful light side, though there are exceptions.
You can breathe air and water.

Accustomed to life underwater, you have superior vision in low light conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Zilkin. Zilkin is characterized by loud, croaking noises from the throat, supported by air stored in the chin.

Your tiny stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use medium or heavy shields. Additionally, you can't wield weapons with the two-handed or versatile property, and you can only wield one-handed weapons in two hands unless they have the light property.

Zilkin are too small to pack much of a punch. You have disadvantage on Strength saving throws, and when determining your bonus to attack and damage rolls for weapon attacks using Strength, you can't add more than +3.
When using downtime for learning a new language or training with a set of tools, it takes half the amount of time and credits necessary to complete.
Zilkin stand between 1 and 2 feet tall and weigh around 10 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Tiny.
You are too small and fast to effectively target. You have a +1 bonus to AC, and you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws.
Your base walking speed is 20 feet.

When you make a long jump, you can cover a number of feet up to twice your Strength score. When you make a high jump, you can leap a number of feet up into the air equal to 3 + twice your Strength modifier.
You have a swimming speed of 20 feet.
Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.
You have proficiency in Acrobatics.
Zygerrians reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Zygerrian culture's emphasis on subjugation and strength causes them to tend towards chaotic dark side, though there are exceptions.
Your unarmed strikes deal [[/r 1d4]] kinetic damage and have the finesse property.

You have a cat's keen senses, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Zygerrian. Zygerrian is characterized by its subtle growls and purrs.

Whenever you make an ability check related to the buying, selling, or controlling of slaves, you are considered proficient in the check. If you would already be proficient, you instead have expertise.
You are proficient in Intimidation, as well as the saberwhip and vibrowhip.
Zygerrians normally stand between 5 to 6 feet tall and weigh about 140 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
